document_title: Nipple discharge (clear white/cloudy): Causes and signs
subsection_name: tiet-dich-num-vu.json_5_How to treat and prevent nipple discharge
subsection_content:
Once the cause of nipple discharge is diagnosed, doctors will develop an appropriate treatment regimen. If the discharge is due to pregnancy or breastfeeding, intervention or treatment may not be needed. Other medical causes of nipple discharge can be treated based on the patient's medical condition and health.
To prevent nipple discharge, women should:
Regularly clean your body, wear a bra that fits your breasts, choose airy materials, and do not wear a bra when it is still damp.; Build a reasonable nutritional diet, add lots of fruits and vegetables, and increase foods rich in omega-3 and fatty acids (fatty fish, nuts).; Exercise regularly with sports such as cycling, jogging, swimming, yoga.; Breast self-examination at home, once a month on the 7th-10th day of the cycle.; Women over 40 years old should be screened for breast disease once a year.; Women aged 20-30 should be screened for breast cancer every 3 years.
